page.title: 05The River Tyne;Leisure
page.content: In recent years the River Tyne has been cleaned by restricting the liquids which factories and others can discharge into the river.Salmon are steadily increasing,although they will never be as prolific as in 1800,when 1600 salmon were netted in one tide.In the last 3 or 4 years a seal has been seen regularly in the river,as far up as Wylam.Its favourite spot seems to be the ramp at the University Rowing Club at Newburn.This year 2 seals were observed. The Tyne is very popular for leisure activities;several children at Newburn First School keep their horses in the stables north of the bridge.The children have observed rowing;water skiing;speed boats;sailing dinghies; canoeing and fishing on the river at Newburn.Various schools and the University have club houses there.
